values: OKAY I GET IT, I SHOULD CALM DOWN. NOW CAN YOU PLEASE LEAVE ME WITH THIS "LESSON LEARNED" SMUG LOOK ON YOUR FACE AND JUST GO AWAY SO I CAN GET BACK TO WORK

I've been working on Thesis since 9:30 yesterday morning. I'm tired. I'm exhausted. And I'm still in a history meeting conference.
And yet I really find my thesis interesting. I'm enjoying the challenge of completing my proposal. I didn't think I'd enjoy thesis this much considering my rocky start to the semester. Hopefully hopefully Ma'am approves.
There's a painful kind of happiness in doing something that you love.

You know, I'm a pretty stable person. Despite my unusual tendencies to pinch people whenever I feel like it, spontaneously utter incoherent words, and my affinity to communicate through yelling, I'm a pretty stable human being. I don't do drugs, I don't use alcohol to escape reality, and I don't carry around a blood stained cutter in my bag for "emo moments". I feel generally well adjusted to life and all it brought down on me; I consider myself happy 95 percent of the time despite the fact that I sometimes keep myself so busy that I'm stressed half the time. Life seemed good, from a general point of view. Yesterday though, when Ma'am Sol totally creamed me for my apparent lack of talent at reading her mind, I went at a downward spiral. I was seriously so unhappy that I was sinfully unproductive the rest of the day. Isn't that pathetic?

Yes, it was totally self inflicted since I totally brought this on myself. That was on the back of my mind the whole effing time yesterday and yet, I couldn't help but continue to kick myself in the ass (Mentally of course. This is still unfortunately physically impossible). After a few hours of wallowing in uselessness, a spark of revelatiion finally stung me. Today, after spending a few hours studying for theology, I realized that I've been living a life worshipping a false god called Anxiety. Anxiety in the fear that I should get back on my top form when it comes to schoolwork as soon as possible so that I can finally have a moment to relax. This made me realize that the only reason I'm not where I want to be right now is because of my unintended Machiavellian thinking. Oh shame.

It is a wonder that I've not felt at ease lately. The jitteriness that accompanies me when I try to finish a paper is a sign from Anxiety, telling me to hurry along up so I can get to work on the next paper. Where is the joy in wanting to read something new for class because it's so interesing? Where is the excitement at attending a new philosophy class? Where did my love for  learning go? What made me so happy to learn and do schoolwork before has now left me in a state of perpetual inconsequence. I must get it back.

Here's to screwing the Anxiety god.

Berlin:

Receptionist: Can you ladies help me out?
Me: Sure, what is it?
Receptionist: Can you tell me if this person is a boy or a girl? The name is Rai Ken Lee.
Me: ... Is that a Korean name?
Receptionist: Yup!

Naku.

Spain:

Old lady in subway station: *speaking fast Spanish and pointing to the rails* ( i think she was asking me when the next train was)
Me: (quizzical brow) No hablo espanol!

During the Bullfight:

Old man sitting next to me: *speaking Spanish very fast and pointing to the ring*
Me: No hablo espanol! (smiles)
Old man: *smiles back and STILL talks in Spanish and points to the ring*
Me: (blinks) Uhm... no hablo espanol?

During a particularly brutal round:

Me: *clutching the neck of my jacket in horror*
Old man: *smiles at me and says in fast Spanish something like* No te gusta?
Me: *shakes head* no hablo no hablo!

On a taxi on the way to the airport:
Taxi driver: *squints at me* are you Japanese?
Me: *sigh* No, I'm from the Philippines!
Taxi Driver: Ah, they speak e Spanish there, noh?

D:

On another note:
-Spain looks like Venice  without the canals. :D
-Bullfights are evil EVIL bloodthirsty events. The slower and bloodier the death of the bull, the more "MUY BIEN MUY BIEN"s you'll hear.
-Bosch's Garden of Earthly Delights is magnificent.
-I almost got robbed on the subway! We were on the way to the hostel when i decided to switch my backpack to my front (I always watch my bag very carefully in the subway) when suddenly, i see a hand inside my bag CLUTCHING MY WALLET! I grab the hand and go "EXCUSE ME!" and the girl goes "excuse me" and drops my wallet. While I'm checking my bag to see if she took anything else, and the people around me were saying something and shooting her dirty looks, she and her accomplice leave the carriage. What a welcome wagon, i tell you.

In Paris in a perfume shop:
Owner: *squints at me* are you Malaysian?
Me: ...uh no. I'm from the Philippines.
Owner: Oh! Is that part of (some continent i can't recall right now)
Me: No, it's an archipelago.

In Ghent:
Chinese/Vietnamese/Korean person walking down the street: chao ween ni?? (continued gibberish)
Me: .... I'm not chinese!

In Rome:
Person working at store: *squints at me*
Me on the phone: Lucia, wala na kong load...
Person working at store: OY PINOY KA PALA!

*sigh*

In Greece:
Creepy guy: Excuse me! Ni hao! Hello! Ni hao! Can i buy you a drink?
Me: uh NO THANKS (runs away)

And finally, London:
Tour guide: (squints at us) and where are you ladies from?
Kate and I: The Philippines!
Tour guide: Oh MABUHAY! KAMUSTA NA KAYO?

While walking down the street:
Guy in a uniform looks at me and says: Are you from Florida?
Me: Uh no, the Philippines!
Guy: oh MABUHAY!
Me: Mabuhay! *pause* wait a minute... I DON'T LOOK AMERICAN!!!

And here i thought i looked totally Flipino. Naku.

Okay, i just checked AISIS for my grades and lo and behold, my new found status is Senior.

Crap.

I don't want to be a Senior! I hate the feeling that school will end in one year  (although i know that that is semi untrue for me as i plan to take a fifth year but still! The feeling is still the same). Why is this happening? I'm sad. I don't want college to end. I want to  stay in school foreeeeeeever.

Note to self: 1.) Love Sol forever. :D 
                       2.) Let it gooo.

I planned to ignore this but since I've been tagged by so many people already that I would feel unbelievably rude if i continued to ignore it.
One of the main reasons why I planned to ignore this is because I DON'T KNOW HOW TO USE NOTES IN FACEBOOK AND AM TOO LAZY TO FIGURE IT OUT RIGHT NOW. But once I figure it out, I swear to all those lovely taggers that I will import this blog entry to facebook.

Scouts honor.

Here's to Sam, Ching, Chris, Aziel, Nyx, Migz, Robin, Roberta, Ryan and whoever else bandwagon-ed me.

 Rules: Once you've been tagged, you are supposed to write a note with 25 random things, facts, habits, or goals about you. At the end, choose 25 people to be tagged. You have to tag the person who tagged you. If I tagged you, it's because I want to know more about you.
 
1.) I don't really have "goals in life". I used to make them but found that they tied me down a lot so I stopped. I just take things a day at a time right now.

2.) I don't cram schoolwork. I always do things in advance. I've had that habit since gradeschool.

3.) I have a thing for keys. Not the modern ugly-and-sometimes-colored ones but the really rustic medieval looking ones. I have a medieval looking key as a key to my room right now and I just want to keep it with me foreeever.

4.) I used to have a stamp collection.

5.) I used to read the Bible everyday when I was like 11. And I read the Children's Bible several times.

6.) I've loved swimming and the sea for as long as I can remember. I feel that it's the closest I can get to actually flying.

7.) I used to write a lot of poetry when I was younger. I still do write but not as much.

8.) I spent my late grade school and early highschool days reading Reader's Digest. I now love reading Newsweek.

9.) I've been correcting people's grammar since I was in gradeschool. 

10.) I used to be the biggest bully ever when I was in gradeschool. I could get away with MURDER. The teachers there loved me. 

11.) I used to believe that if I wasn't forced to take ballet, singing, and painting lessons that I'd actually really like them and maybe even have gotten into them.

12.) I love being weird, weird people, and weird things. I find weirdness so interesting.

13.) I hate liars. I feel that lying is the highest form of disrespect towards a person albeit's done with good intentions.

14.) I love babies. I used to work in an orphanage the summer before first year college and I try to visit the orphanage for Christmas every year after that.

15.) My comfort foods are wheatbread with crumpy, pancit canton, bolognese spaghetti, and pizza. (How appropriate that all my comfort foods aren't healthy- with the exception of the wheatbread- considering how health-freakish I am right now) 

16.) I'm lactose intolerant. This usually doesn't bother me since I don't drink milk in the Philippines. But then I discovered FULL CREAM EUROPEAN MILK and am now having milk with cereal (caramel flavored) almost every morning for breakfast.

17.) I make funny noises for no reason sometimes.

18.) I honestly enjoyed almost every class I've ever taken in Ateneo (with the obvious exception of SA). I greatly admire most of the teachers I've studied under. I think Ma'am Sol, Fr. Dacanay, Sir Chua, and Sir Lozada are truly excellent teachers. If I ever become a philologist, teacher, or researcher, I would like to have as much passion for my work as Ma'am Sol has for hers.

19.) I used to love going out to parties and stuff in highschool but now I've become more of a homebody (CURSE YOU, ATENEO WORKLOAD!) and I honestly don't mind. 

20.) I see my room as my own private sanctuary.

21.) I have adjustment issues. That's one of the main reasons I went to Belgium.

22.) I LOVE eating pizza crusts with pepsi. I used to even dip the crust in my glass of pepsi and then eat it (like how most people dip their oreos in milk). I also like eating chocolate and mocha cake with milk though I just keep the cake in my mouth and drink milk at the same time ( though i rarely do that anymore).

23.) I co-wrote a batch song that our batch in zobel loved but didn't win. My friend and I wrote used to write songs for people back then.

24.) I used to dream of becoming a scientist- specifically a geneticist. I might have, actually, if I didn't hate chemistry so much. I also dreamed of becoming a doctor but now I realize that if i ever fulfill that dream that I'd want to become a homeopathic doctor.

25.) I am my own worst critic. I hardly ever let anyone see what i write (with the exception of that piece that got published in highschool- but even THAT was an accident) especially now that I've learned how to critique work better.

I'll tag when I figure out the notes thing in Facebook. :))

In other news:
I just drank the "Best Beer in the World" (otherwise known as Trappist Westvleteren Beer). I see why it's so special since the taste is so smooth but I rather prefer the Kriek Lindeman cherry beer more. 
I also just ate excellent Belgian chocolates called Verstraete. It was unbelievably delicious.
I love love LOVE Belgian waffles!

So today started out pretty well. I went and had my boots designed and they'll be ready in 2 weeks. That was fun. Then I went to Mall of Asia to buy gloves at Zara with their wonderful sale going on. Then I went home, where my cousin's boyfriend fixed my laptop which is great seeing as how my desktop decided to die last night. All of which made me smile.

And then my grandfather threw up blood and was rushed to the hospital. I'm at home keeping my grandmother company so she doesn't freak out and have another stroke. 

It's been barely two months since we had to rush my grandfather to the hospital. It feels like all these hospital trips will never end.

Dec 30
We left for the beach today! I couldn't swim or anything which bummed me out but just the thought of going to the beach made me happy already. When we arrived I went boating with my aunt and uncles. I LOVE boating. I love the sea, the scenery, and the sky. Everything was breathtaking. Looking at everything reminded me just how much I'm going to miss the beach when I'm in Europe.

Dec 31
New Year's Eve with crazy family members! I shall never forget my aunt who was yelling for marijuana and my grand uncle who dances like he's thirty. We had cheese, grapes, and fireworks in that order. Twas fun. I couldn't drink because i was a little sick but it was fun enough watching everyone else go crazy. The aunts and uncles kept making my brother dance for them as well as with them.

OH and in the afternoon when I went boating with my aunts and uncles again, we had to stop by the beach to pick up my uncle's son and his cousins. The weather wasn't so great and the swells were HUGE so they had to swim to the boat to get to us. Long story short, the whole situation almost turned out into a Baywatch episode; except no one had to jump in to save them in the end (I volunteered to but my dad put an end to that so he was the one volunteered into it) since they just almost drowned instead of really drowned. Haha.

Jan 2
My dad's birthday! Haha. We had a lunch here for him where the generations of the family were separated by tables. The theology teachers came by too with Rabeh and Eric in tow. Ugh the family had a field day making them uncomfortable. I felt so bad for them. But they did make my cousin very happy so I'm thankful for their awkwardness as well. 

After lunch we went laser tag-ing with the cousins. IT WAS SUPER FUN! This girl in charge must have had her period or something because she was so mean to us. She didn't even brief us about the game before we went in the "zone" so we didn't know what to the heck to do so we were just shooting and running around without a strategy during the first game. By the second game, when we finally got briefed, we totally kicked ass. We were the kings of the court! AND I WAS THE NUMBER ONE SHOOTER OF THE WHOLE GAME! 10, 000 plus points BWAHAHAHA. (as opposed to being second to the last in the first game)

After the game, we went shopping in the fashion market and had dinner in Itallianis where we totally abused the free bread. 

Life is good.

Dec 27
Today is eating-out-at-hooters-and-iceberg day with Alabangers and one Northerner! Bwahahaha! Hooters was weird. There was nothing to "see", if you know what I mean.And the food was weird! They fooled us size wise and they gave me the wrong side dish to my burger meal. When we were thinking of complaining just for fun, I saw the fine print at the bottom of the ad that said "not exactly as shown". BAH.

Anyway, after eating at hooters we walked around the San Mig by the Bay baywalk thing and saw children in bubbles running around the pool! Rich thinks that's how they power MOA. Slave Labor!

And then Javi got a nosebleed from "speaking too much tagalog" :D

Then iceberg! Where the ice cream was YUMMY. Yay! Ice cream and Alabangers always makes me happy. 

Dec 28
HIKING UP TAAL LAKE WITH COUSINS day. I say this in all caps for one reason: the experience was horseshit. LITERALLY horseshit. It was everywhere! As in you have to look down all the time to make sure you didn't step on anything everywhere. And the riders were so RUDE. I yelled at several of them when they asked us to move out of the way (I don't even know WHY they asked when there was like so much room AROUND us this one time. All the other times, they didn't follow the traffic flow. Philippines talaga.) There was this one time that this rider was complaining for my cousin to get out of the way saying "kita mo sila, ang siga siga pa" and I was all pissed and yelled "ANG BASTOS KAYO EH". When my other cousins found out what I did, they said they were proud that I could curse in tagalog (but in fairness, I always curse in tagalog. I must have yelled PUNYETA at people like 10 times today. HAHA.)

I put this down as my Thing that Made Me Happy Today because in general, i love hiking. i love the fresh air, the exercise, and especially the view. There's no other beauty like nature beauty. And hanging out with people i don't get to see very often is always a plus.

Dec 26

I FINALLY sorted through the clothes I want to bring to Belgium. It's such a sense of accomplishment, I tell you. Now i know what to go shopping for when i go to Greenhills. I also gave away lots of pants to the maids so that they can give it to their families. They were very happy. That made me happy too. :)

After all that. Javy and i played Zelda for like 8 hours. We went to bed at 3 a.m. I love doing these things with him. We used to do this all the time when we lived in Cebu. I help him out when he needs it but I watch him most of the time. I think he enjoys playing more when I watch him. :))

The rules are that for 8 days, you have to post something that made you happy that day. Tag 8 people to do the same.

I tag Rich, Robin, Carlo, Vinny, Panopio, Romeo, Gi, and Jes

Day 1: Christmas Day
Unwrapping gifts at midnight is always a good start to Christmas Day. Later on in the evening, we had our traditional cousins karaoke- except this time it was held at the store instead of Red Box. So instead of karaoke and pool, we had karaoke, Rockband World Tour, Dance Dance Revolution, and Acquire. Cousins karaoke is always sabaw. We sing anything and everything, no joke. Even though most of us can't sing, we still pick the high note songs just so we can shout it out together. It's crazy. We make it a point to sing songs like "Hanging by the Moment" and "It's My Life". You know, all the secret guilty pleasures of people. Oh and our favorite must-sing-no-matter-how-tired/drunk-we-are is  "Total Eclipse of the Heart". And we sing it with feeling, people!

Ah yes, whatta day. A toast to the drunken, raspy, and croaky cousins! May we be tone deaf forever. :)

Merry Christmas everyone!

(And happy picket lining for Rich. I love you! You're the best advocate for humanity ever!)

HABURDAY CHINGALING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

REMEMBER: Birthdays are like boogers. The more you have, the harder it is to breathe. :D

Have a good one!!

Goodbye to leisure readings and all day movie marathons.

On the other hand, hello to cool subjects.

:D

- Pick 15 of your favourite movies.
- Go to IMDb and find a quote from each movie.
- Post them here for everyone to guess.
- Fill in the film title once it's guessed.
- NO GOOGLING/using IMDb search functions.

1.)   Don't blow smoke up my ass, it will ruin my autopsy.

2.)  You seem more like the cat that got the cream and couldn't stop licking himself. 

3.) Remember that chap about twenty years ago? I forget his name. Climbed Everest without any oxygen, came down nearly dead. When they asked him, they said why did you go up there to die? He said I didn't, I went up there to live.

4.) Do you know what my daughter's nurse told her today? "In a girl's voice lies temptation - a known fact. Eloquence in a woman means promiscuity. Promiscuity of the mind leads to promiscuity of the body." She doesn't believe it yet, but she will. She'll grow up just like her mother. Marry, raise children and honor her family. Spend her youth in needlepoint and rue the day she was born a girl. And when she dies, she'll wonder why she obeyed all the rules of God and Country for no biblical hell could ever be worse than a state of perpetual inconsequence.

5.) Never is an awfully long time.

6.) I dare do all to dare become a man, who dares do more is none.

7.) Oh look, my tax dollars at work coming to arrest me.

8.) No. You want you to find this, because the finding of this finds you incapacitorially finding and or locating in your discovering the detecting of a way to save your dolly belle, ol' what's-her-face. Savvy?

9.) I'm quivering with anticipation.

10.) Do you think anything might tempt me to accept the hand of the man who has ruined, perhaps for ever, the happiness of a most beloved sister? Do you deny that you separated a young couple who loved each other, exposing your friend to censure of the world for caprice and my sister to derision for disappointed hopes, involving them both in misery of the acutest kind?

11.)  All right, Lewis, knock em' dead. That was a figure of speech. Please don't kill anyone.

12.) The brave do not live forever, but the cautious do not live at all.

13.) If you're not willing to act stupid then you don't deserve to fall in love.

14.) I own the hotel, and I live there. My life is very much like Monopoly.

15.) Just because you've got the emotional range of a teaspoon doesn't mean we all have!

My cousin who is taking up her Phd in Theology at The Boston University gave me an article that I find very interesting and wish to share. 

Whehee.


Dr. Laura Schlessinger is a US radio personality who dispenses advice to people who call in to her radio

show. She has said that, as an observant Orthodox Jew, homosexuality is an abomination according to

Leviticus 18:22, and cannot be condoned under any circumstance. The following is an open letter to Dr.

Laura penned by a US resident, which was posted on the Internet. It's funny, as well as informative:

Dear Dr. Laura:

Thank you for doing so much to educate people regarding God's Law. I have learned a great deal from your show, and try to share that knowledge with as many people as I can. When someone tries to defend the

homosexual lifestyle, for example, I simply remind them that Leviticus 18:22 clearly states it to be an

abomination. End of debate. I do need some advice from you, however, regarding some of the other specific

laws and how to follow them.

 

1. When I burn a bull on the altar as a sacrifice, I know it creates a pleasing odor for the Lord - Lev.1:9. The

problem is my neighbors. They claim the odor is not pleasing to them. Should I smite them?\

 

2. I would like to sell my daughter into slavery, as sanctioned in Exodus 21: 7. In this day and age, what do you think would be afair price for her?

3. I know that I am allowed no contact with a woman while she is in her period of menstrual cleanliness -

Lev. 15: 19-24. The problem is, how do I tell? I have tried asking, but most women take offense

.

4. Lev. 25:44 states that I may indeed possess slaves, both male and female, provided they are purchased from neighboring nations. A friend of mine claims that this applies to Mexicans, but not Canadians. Can you clarify? Why can't I own Canadians?

 

5. I have a neighbor who insists on working on the Sabbath. Exodus 35:2 clearly states he should be put to

death. Am I morally obligated to kill him myself?

 

6. A friend of mine feels that even though eating shellfish is an abomination - Lev. 11: 10, it is a lesser

abomination than homosexuality. I don't agree. Can you settle this?

 

7. Lev. 21:20 states that I may not approach the altar of God if I have a defect in my sight. I have to admit that I wear reading glasses. Does my vision have to be 20/20, or is there some wiggle room here?

 

8. Most of my male friends get their hair trimmed, including the hair around their temples, even though this is expressly forbidden by Lev. 19:27. How should they die?

 

9. I know from Lev. 11:6-8 that touching the skin of a dead pig makes me unclean, but may I still play football if I wear gloves?

 

10. My uncle has a farm. He violates Lev. 19:19 by planting two different crops in the same field, so does his wife by wearing garments made of two different kinds of thread (cotton/polyester blend). He also tends to curse and blaspheme a lot. Is it really necessary that we go to all the trouble of getting the whole town together to stone them? - Lev.24:10-16. Couldn't we just burn them to death at a private family affair like we do with people who sleep with their in-laws? (Lev. 20: 14)

 

I know you have studied these things extensively, so I am confident you can help. Thank you again for

reminding us that God's word is eternal and unchanging.

Your devoted disciple and adoring fan,

. C.Johnson




This one is just cute.

The Gay Agenda

"Homosexual Agenda, " but no one has ever seen a copy of it. Well, I have finally obtained a

copy directly from the Head Homosexual. It follows below:

6:00 AM Gym

8:00 AM Breakfast (oatmeal and egg whites)

9:00 AM Hair appointment

10:00 AM ShoppinE

12:00 PM Brunch

2:00 PM

1)Assume complete control of the U.S. Federal, State and Local Governments as well as all

other national governments,

2) Recruit all straight youngsters to our debauched lifestyle,

3) Destroy all healthy heterosexual marriages,

4) Replace all school counselors in grades K-12 with agents of Colombian and Jamaican drug

cartels,

5) Establish planetary chain of homo breeding gulags where over-medicated imprisoned straight

women are turned into artificially impregnated baby factories to produce prepubescent love

slaves for our devotedly pederastic gay leadership,

7) Secure total control of the INTERNET and all mass media for the exclusive use of child

pornographers.

8:00 PM Theater

11:00PM Bed (dujour)

I didn't like having to be in a room full of people that i love, people who put on such strong convincing composures to keep everyone calm, just to see them break down and lose it.

I didn't like having to see the most loving person in the world go through suffering like that
I didn't like that she cried because it hurt so much
And i didn't like the fact that she asked a PRIEST to come in because of it
I didn't like how she was that scared
I didn't like how scared everyone else was

I didn't like how scared I was

I didn't like the tears that they cried
Even though they tried to hide it
I didn't like how they put on their brave faces
For the sake of not raising a panic
Only to see it break
And start one

I didn't like hearing the "she's okay" and the "she just needs rest" reassurances
When I see the worry in their eyes
I did not like hearing those reassurances
When she was in pain and started to cry


She's the best grandmother anyone could ever ask for. She's the most loving, motherly person that i know. She has a good heart.

SHE DOES NOT DESERVE THIS



If she's going to be okay then by all means let all the dictates of the universe MAKE HER WELL.

please

So, what's the secret behind karma?

But first of all, how does karma work?

For example, if i hit someone by accident, does karma therefore condemn me to experience something of the same misfortune even if my infliction of pain to that person was accidental?

What if i want to intentionally hurt someone but end up not doing so? Does the mere fact that i intended to condemn me to experience someone else's equally, if not more intensified, intended and unshown wrath?

"The universe is equal and fair in all things"
-True in all aspects? I would think so. Tell me in all perspectives, how can the universe be anything but?

"Do unto others what you want others to do unto you"
-Pretty ambiguous, don't you think? it can have so many meanings because it's not exactly specified.
What if what I do to you is essentially good but it doesn't turn out so good in the end anyway? Does karma condemn or reward me for the pretense or the conclusion?

"The end justifies the means"
-Can you really offer credence to people who do good things but yet had no intention of doing the said "good things" in the first place?

So, in response to this little rant, the unanswered question still remains:

 Is Karma a response to the intention or reaction?

*grumbles at being tagged*

 bwahaha! i got tagged by phil.

RULES

The first player of this game starts with the "6 weird things/habits about yourself" and people who get tagged need to write a blog of their 6 weird habits/things, as well as state this rule clearly.. in the end, you need to choose 6 people to be tagged and list their names... (Source: )

1.) I find it hard to throw away empty shampoo bottles and whatnot. They pile up under my bathroom sink. I keep thinking that I'd give them to some recycling plant but it never pushes through. :|

2.) I like babies more than toddlers. It's just easier to take care of them and they're so cuuuuute.

3.) I don't like taking western medicines. (what?? i don't like the after effects!)
So I'm pretty much dead when i get a headache in the mall.

4.) I have to hit people. Don't ask me why. I just DO. (bwehehehehehe)

5.) If I want to, I can let a little amount of alcohol (like half a bottle of beer) affect me as much as 2 wine bottles would. (mind over matter, i tell you!)

..... or i may just have weak tolerance. Go figure. :P

6.) i eat breakfast at midnight. :D

I tag Panopski, Justin, Nielyman, Jim, Carlo and Rich. 

-----
I know what some people will say is lacking here, and i tell you now:
IT IS NOT WEIRD FOR PEOPLE TO HATE PINK.
or ANY bright colors for that matter! 

grar.

I wonder what it would be like to see life in a half spirit. If we are half spirit and half body, we're two halves of a whole. But when you live in your half spirit, how can you experience any emotion at all if all your emotions come from what signals you receive from your body?

You can't feel pain if you don't see the cause of it first.
You can't feel enlightened if you don't have the touch of life.
You can't feel love if you have no taste for it.

If we lived in our spirit only,
What then, does the spirit experience?

Purity?

We're untainted in that sense. Since we never have to deal with the alacrity of emotions that are the cause of the taint in spirit.

Hmmm...

Add a touch of asperity in that and it could be called emo.

Haha.

Fool!

You ask for directions to a place where none have treaded before.
So it doesn't really matter what path you choose to take. 

For the path of which you walk on has not been treaded before.



Do you think it so wise that you break down these walls?
Do you not know of the evil of which you attempt to free?
It wasn't the armies that lost the battle.
It wasn't kings that sat on the throne.

She looked down on you, and you let her! She asked you to swim, and you crossed the seven seas!
The perennial soldier, have you no doubt?
The lives that she ruined, the souls that she freed?

Do you really think that it was not seen?
The uncanny deceit of all the treacherous lies!

Fool!

This insult may fade at the aging of time.
But do not think that your silly attempt is a venial crime.

People see better at night than they do in the morning.

Because at night, you won't have the sun stinging your eye.



Wake me up to the blood red moon
with the sun so blue and gray
Set me down on the dying sea
where all that breathe remain

Out i come
Relieved of pain
The stings come out so true
The time has passed
The moment's cast
Memories are what remain.

I want to create temptation
While dancing in the rain
I want to destroy desire
for basking in it

I want to create temptation
because of this unwanted desire
that brings forth an age
that i wish never to come

Somewhere in the darkness
the moon smiles at me
and i think of the times
that i danced under its glow

The moon smiles at me
while im dancing in the rain
his eyes full of sorrow
for he sees the past return

I bask in this desire
because i fear its return
as dreams corrupt my sleep
and visions cloud my mind
I wish for darkness to smile at me
moon or no moon.

The river speaks in this humble abyss.

Can you name something more enchanting and immortal as the river? It flows and flows; and yet it is always the same. But at every moment, it is rendered anew. 
The secret of prosperity.
All the secrets that the river holds lay at the bottom. Where the rocks have fallen..

Would you be a rock thrown into a river? Where all the rock has to go is down. It has one destination, one path to follow. That is the only path it knows. It goes through the flow of life doing nothing. And yet it gets what it wants.. It goes where it wishes.

What a life that would be if we could get everything that we want. If we just sit idly by and let life pass us. Accepting what it has to offer and neglecting those it has not. Like the rock in the river. It falls into life and when it reaches the bottom, that's it. It's just there. It exists. It neither rejoices nor complains about its conditions because it knows nothing more than what it has been created to be.

The river cannot do anything about it. It is ethereal. Just like life. It watches, as each stone, in its misery or joy, sinks to the bottom of this cold, enchanting lair. Where many secrets live and die. Where many secrets are left untold.

Funny at how mysteries are what keep us alive.

"How do we remember?

Is the brain a jar that holds our memories?

Then when we die, does the jar break?

Are our memories spilled on the ground

and lost?

Or is the brain a map

that leads down twisted paths

and into hidden corners?

Then when we die, the map is lost

but perhaps some explorer

could wander through that strange landscape

and find out the hiding places

of our misplaced memories."

 

-The God Whispers of Han Qing-jao

 

I propose a toast to the lords and ladies of this masquerade! Whose attendance would surely have been missed.

A toast to the people who hide behind their masks! Hoping against hope that they remain unseen.

A toast to those same people who wish to hide in shame for their treacheries and misdeeds.

Those same people who don't have the courage to stand up for what they have done wrong.

And show their faces for all it's worth.

A toast to those who do have the courage to avail!

To those who no longer live in the shadow of their masks.

A toast to this masquerade! Where people only live in harmony because they refuse to take off the mask that binds them!

A toast to the masquerade of inequities and faults.

As well as the masquerade of justice and perfection.

A toast...

to the masquerade of life

Has any one of you ever been tucked into bed?

I haven't.

At least to my recollection.
How strange. I never thought about being tucked in before. Although I always wondered what that would feel like since I've never experienced it. Until last night.

I think...

I think I was "tucked in" last night. Without even knowing it.

See, I've gone into the habit of going to bed without closing my curtains. (I get to see the sun come up if I've pulled an "all nighter" on weekends) I'm also a messy sleeper. I sleep with 3 pillows and a comforter. Come morning, my comforter is a twisted cloth and one of my pillows will most likely be on the floor. Last night was no different. I didn't close the curtains and my comforter was under my arms. (mid-body, more like)

But when i woke up this morning, they were closed. And my comforter was covering my whole body neatly. (notice the word "neatly") 
Imagine my shock when I woke up to darkness instead of light. And imagine my suprise when I didn't have to pull my comforter over me because of the chill I feel every morning when I wake up.

What a funny feeling.

Yet, for some unexplainable reason, I knew that my dad tucked me in last night.

Yes, I did go to bed at around 1:30. And I know that the possibilities of him being awake at that time and having this sudden urge to "tuck me in" is quite slim seeing as how he hardly ever does that...  

But somehow... I feel/know that it was him.

It's silly, I know.

But it's a new experience for me.

What a funny feeling.

I'm walking on pebbles im walking on pebbles
what a wonderful thing
to be walking on pebbles

One night a guy and a girl were driving home from the movies. The boy sensed there was something wrong because of the painful silence they shared between them that night. The girl then asked the boy to pull over because she wanted to talk. She told him that her feelings had changed, and that it was time to move on. A silent tear slid down his cheek as he slowly reached into his pocket and passed her a folded note. At that moment, a drunk driver was speeding down that very same street. He swerved right into the drivers seat, killing the boy. Miraculously, the girl survived. Remembering the note, she pulled it out and read it. "Without your love, I would die."

I'm sure that every one of you here has experienced sadness and disappointment. Towards yourselves or towards the people around you.

Be it family or friends... People tend to disappoint. 

If you found out that a close friend of yours is not the person you thought he/she was, what would you do?

If you just realized that a close friend of yours has been lying to you since you've first known him/her, what would you do?

If you just found out that a close friend has been abusing your friendship, what would you do?

If you had to cope with that person for years because you thought that you could help change that person.. only to find out that its all been for nothing.... What would you do?

If you found out that the person whom you thought was decent, turned out to be a wild party animal who makes out and screws strangers at a party... what would you do?

If you found out that your really close friend did this to you, would you not feel disappointed in that person?

He/she lied to you about who he/she really was for YEARS.

You knew this person really well. (or at least you thought you did)

This person has betrayed your trust.

What would you do?

--------------

i slept at 7 o clock in the morning yesterday because of this little problem. As you can see... I am very disturbed with whats happened. Not to mention traumatized. (yes, traumatized. what caused that is too....er..... private to discuss.)

There is a story behind this. But i'd rather not elaborate.

Please state your opinions. Im interested in hearing them.

i worry about the silliest things (if you would call them silly)

do you realize how much our parents spend just to keep their kids comfortable and happy? 

do you realize how much our parents spend to keep us safe and alive?

do you realize how bratty some kids get to parents who work soo hard just to give us a life to live?

and yet, how do these kids repay them? by doing bad in school, wasting their money on useless things, overspending, being a bitch to deal with...

do you see why some parents are always in a bad mood whenever they come home? on top of the huge pile of work they have to deal with, they have to put up with the bills and the taxes and their kids who are unappreciative and unthoughtful.

i hate coming across kids who are such friggin brats. they have no idea of the harsh life our parents go through for their kids. and even if they do what do they do about it?

nothing. nothing to make it better at least. those kids who constantly ask for things, talk back, disrespect and constantly disappoint their parents.

i pity kids like that. really.

i take my hat off to those kids who are making something of themselves. those who are excelling in their lives by improving on themselves and making their parents happy.

i think that thats what most parents want from their kids. to make something of ourselves.

that way, we aren't throwing our lives away.
we aren't wasting their efforts.
we're making them proud.

Really, how else can we repay them?
